paragraphs.content: Psalm 94
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 94

paragraphs.content: O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.

paragraphs.content: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.

paragraphs.content: LORD, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?

paragraphs.content: How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?

paragraphs.content: They break in pieces thy people, O LORD, and afflict thine heritage.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They break in pieces thy people, O Lord, and afflict thine heritage.

paragraphs.content: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.

paragraphs.content: Yet they say, The LORD shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet they say, The Lord shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.

paragraphs.content: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?

paragraphs.content: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?

paragraphs.content: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he know?
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he know?

paragraphs.content: The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.

paragraphs.content: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Lord, and teachest him out of thy law;

paragraphs.content: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

paragraphs.content: For the LORD will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.

paragraphs.content: But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.

paragraphs.content: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

paragraphs.content: Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Unless the Lord had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.

paragraphs.content: When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O LORD, held me up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O Lord, held me up.

paragraphs.content: In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.

paragraphs.content: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?

paragraphs.content: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.

paragraphs.content: But the LORD is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But the Lord is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.

paragraphs.content: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the LORD our God shall cut them off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the Lord our God shall cut them off.
